author: John Donnal
description: read data from file or named pipe
module_config:
[Main]
name = Random Reader
exec_cmd = joule-file-reader /name/of/file

[Arguments]
timestamps = yes # [yes|no]

[Outputs]
output = /path/to/output
name: File Reader
outputs:
<dl class="row">
<dt class="col-sm-3 text-truncate">output</dt>
<dd class="col-sm-9">float32 with N elements auto detected from input source</dd>
</dl>

stream_configs.config:
[Main]
name = File Data
path = /path/to/output
datatype = float32
keep = 1w

# [width] number of elements
[Element1]
name = Data Column 1

[Element2]
name = Data Column 2

#additional elements...
stream_configs.name: output

usage:
Read data in from a file or a named pipe. Optionally add timestamps to data (note, this should only be used for real time sources. The 8us difference in example below is the actual time taken to read the file line)

Example:

  $> cat /tmp/file
  3 4
  4 6
  $> joule-file-reader --timestamps=yes /tmp/file
  1485274825371860 3.0 4.0
  1485274825371868 5.0 6.0

author: John Donnal
module_config:
[Main]
name = Random Reader
exec_cmd = joule modules random-reader

[Arguments]
width = 4
rate = 10 #Hz

[Outputs]
output = /path/to/output
name: Random Reader
outputs:
<dl class="row">
<dt class="col-sm-3 text-truncate">output</dt>
<dd class="col-sm-9">float32 with N elements specified by [width] argument</dd>
</dl>

stream_configs.config:
[Main]
name = Random Data
path = /path/to/output
datatype = float32
keep = 1w

# [width] number of elements
[Element1]
name = Random Set 1

[Element2]
name = Random Set 2

#additional elements...
stream_configs.name: output

usage:
This is a module that generates random numbers. Specify width (number of elements) and the rate in Hz.

Arguments Description
width number of elements
rate data rate in Hz

author: John Donnal
inputs:
input
with N elements
module_config:
[Main]
name = Mean Filter
exec_cmd = joule-mean-filter

[Arguments]
window = 11 # must be odd

[Inputs]
input = /path/to/input 

[Outputs]
output = /path/to/output
name: Mean Filter
outputs:
output
float32 with N elements

stream_configs.config:
[Main]
name = Raw Data
path = /path/to/input
datatype = int32
keep = 1w

[Element1]
name = Element 1

[Element2]
name = Element 2

#additional elements...
stream_configs.name: input

stream_configs.config:
[Main]
name = Filtered Data
path = /path/to/output
datatype = float32
keep = 1w

#same number of elements as input
[Element1]
name = Element 1

[Element2]
name = Element 2

#additional elements...
stream_configs.name: output

usage:
Apply a moving average to the input stream with an adjustable window size

Arguments Description
window samples to average, must be odd
